availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Seidner Giltner (Minister, president and teacher at Eminence College in Henry County, Kentucky)

body.p: A Kentucky Disciples of Christ minister, educator, and school administrator. Lived in Henry County, Kentucky in 1860. Graduated from Bethany College (West Virginia). Ordained a Christian minister in 1852. Married twice, first to Sarah E. Raines Giltner and on a second occasion to Mary E. Ogdon Duncan Giltner. Father of Annabel Giltner, Elizabeth Giltner, Leigh G. Giltner, William S. Giltner, Jr., and Johnie Giltner. A charter member of the Eminence Independent Order of Odd-Fellows in 1858. Served as a teacher and president of Eminence College, a coeducational institution in Kentucky, from 1858 to 1893.

bibl.p: Alvin F. Lewis, "History of Higher Education in Kentucky," United States Bureau of Education, Circular of Information No. 3, 1899 (Washington: Government Printing Office, 1899), 325-327; “Eminence College,” The Kentucky Encyclopedia, ed. John E. Kleber (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 293; "William Sidner Giltner," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=28396690&ref=acom) (accessed on April 18, 2017); "Giltner," The Bourbon News (Paris, Ky.), December 20, 1921; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision No. 1, p. 141; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District of Eminance, p. 17.
